messages.message: Has anyone ever seen an error code 502 coming from refiner (or any app)? GS is reporting an issue with Refiner 5 and Flows (with an apply_refiner), where they're getting an "Error Code 502" when loading in 400+ page PDFs. I can't reproduce it, and I'm curious if anyone has seen anything similar. @Varun Jain (and maybe me too if we can't figure it out beforehand) is talking to their team at 8:30 PT tonight, so any help would be much appreciated.
@Erick @Kerry I think I know what the error is
It is api-server OOM when we are trying to fetch the images for rendering the results page
I'll ask them to increase the memory and will report back in case that fixes it
And why would the flow be failing? Or do you think that's not actually failing? I feel like the first message was something about running an `.ibprog` in a flow...
I don’t think the Flow fails, I think it just fails to render the results — we’ve seen similar issue at BofA
thanks @shaunak - let’s see if it works!
Thanks @shaunak - your brain is an encyclopedia of all strange customer errors :smile:
we need a searchable directory of Shaunak’s brain @Kerry! I’m sure we will find many more strange things in there :slightly_smiling_face:

Lol, this does not pass the bus-test :stuck_out_tongue: which is why we started writing the Common Dataflow Operations (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OFnm3Q9gKsR36U9Wmx14G5cnfHK8BdBheBO6UdBbJX4/edit) document :slightly_smiling_face: Hopefully, we’ll have enough datapoints so that customers can do most of the debugging themselves.
